facts: Russia is the largest country in the world by land area, stretching across Europe and Asia.
The Nile River and the Amazon River are both often cited as the world’s longest river, depending on how scientists measure them.
Mount Everest is the highest mountain above sea level, rising on the border between Nepal and China (Tibet).
The Sahara is the largest hot desert on Earth, covering much of North Africa.
The Pacific Ocean is the largest and deepest ocean, and it contains the Mariana Trench, the deepest known point on Earth.
Antarctica is the coldest continent and holds most of Earth’s fresh water locked up as ice.
The Equator is an imaginary line around Earth that divides the planet into the Northern and Southern Hemispheres.
